poem:
**A View from Across the Pond**

In a morning cluttered with headlines,  
a map sprawls unrolled, continents  
trembling at inked lines,  
while bay windows divulge grey skies.  
Peace whispers between cups of tea,  
hinting at a rainy compromise,  
yet the radio blares trumpets of war,  
unraveling threads  
only time can knit anew.
